intro: Leiphaimos kupperi, commonly known as the Kupperi's orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to specific regions of Greece. It is characterized by its unique, elongated flower spikes that bear numerous small, delicate flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually a mix of white and green hues, with a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
